    question => UTF-8 string (425) "<p>3. Names of the person(s) from the entity involved in the discussion:</p>...
    $value[2]['question']
    <p>3.	Names of the person(s) from the entity involved in the discussion:</p>
<p><i>This must include a representative from ‘those charged with governance’ (e.g. a director of the company) and management. Whilst for many entities ‘those charged with governance’ will also be ‘management’, where Ac2 identifies that this is not the case, it must be ensured that going concern is discussed with both groups.</i></p>

    question => UTF-8 string (647) "<p>5. If the entity has not prepared formal forecasts or similar for a perio...
    $value[4]['question']
    <p>5.	If the entity has not prepared formal forecasts or similar for a period of at least twelve months from the end of the reporting period, document the nature of the client’s assessment of going concern. </p>
<i>
    <p>This assessment could include:</p>
    <ul>
        <li>Formal budgets on a rolling quarterly basis looking forward, supported by a more informal assessment of the subsequent period</li>
        <li>Informal assessment by way of expectations of the level of repeat custom and expenses, timing of significant orders, working capital requirements, significant future ‘one-off’ expenditure etc.</li>
    </ul>
</i>

    question => UTF-8 string (526) "<p>6. Consider any other specific issues that could impact on the going conc...

    <p>6.  Consider any other specific issues that could impact on the going concern status of the client, these might include:-</p>
<ul>
    <li>Impending litigation, or regulatory action against the client; </li>
    <li>Changes in legislation or government (both national and local) policy;</li>
    <li>Changes to local planning law which could adversely affect the client; and</li>
    <li>Technological or market developments which would render the client’s products or services obsolete or uncompetitive.</li>
</ul>

    question => UTF-8 string (587) "<p>1. <strong>No material uncertainty:</strong></p> <p>If events or conditio...
    $value[0]['question']
    <p>1.  <strong>No material uncertainty:</strong></p>
<p>If events or conditions have been identified that may cast significant doubt on the entity’s ability to continue as a going concern but, based on the audit evidence obtained the auditor concludes that no material uncertainty exists, have adequate disclosures been made about these events or conditions?</p>
<p>Where the auditor concludes that management’s use of the going concern basis is appropriate and no material uncertainty exists, the auditor is required to report by exception in the audit report on such matters.</p>

    question => UTF-8 string (1173) "<p>2. <strong>Material uncertainty:</strong></p> <p>Where events and conditi...
    $value[1]['question']
    <p>2.  <strong>Material uncertainty:</strong></p>
<p>Where events and conditions are identified which give rise to a material uncertainty with respect to going concern, has adequate disclosure been made in the financial statements?</p>
<p>The financial statements must:</p>
<ul>
    <li>adequately disclose the principal events or conditions that may cast significant doubt on the entity’s ability to continue as a going concern and management’s plans to deal with these events or conditions; and </li>
    <li>Disclose clearly that there is a material uncertainty related to events or conditions that may cast significant doubt on the entity’s ability to continue as a going concern and, therefore, that it may be unable to realize its assets and discharge its liabilities in the normal course of business.</li>
</ul>
<p>If adequate disclosure has been made, the opinion shall be unmodified but the audit report shall include a separate section under the heading “Material uncertainty related to Going Concern”.</p>
<p>If adequate disclosure is not made, the auditor shall express a qualified opinion or adverse opinion, in accordance with ISA 705.</p>
